B'aa:
Watermark B’.a.a. can be distinguished by several features: the bottom of the shield is flat, below the shield are the initials PV, there is a single band in the crown, and a chain line runs through the center of the watermark.

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints:

  • Three oriental figures, 1641, (B. 118 i/ NHD 190 i), National Gallery of Art, Washington (NGA 1943.3.7262). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 i/ NHD 211 i), Bibliothéque Nationale de France, Paris (BNP B.188i). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 i/ NHD 211 i), British Museum, London (BM 1973-U.956). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 ii/ NHD 211 ii), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK OB.246). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 ii/ NHD 211 ii), John Pierpont Morgan Library, New York (JPM Van B.188ii)+. Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 ii/ NHD 211 ii), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK 61:1096). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 ii/ NHD 211 ii), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK 61:1096), Frits Lugt Collection, Institut Néerlandais, Paris (FRC 84). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 iii/ NHD 211 iii), Bibliothéque Nationale de France, Paris (BNP B.188iii). Folio sheet.
  • The flute player, 1642, (B.188 iii/ NHD 211 iii), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK 61:1097). Folio sheet.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 63)
